Whether PRP ’s DT “ flower revolution ” or Michel Foucault , trends and ideas are often delayed , and seem almost cutely anachronistic by DT NN PRP make landfall down under . Wedded to DT insatiable urge to reap , rent and remove from DT NN , and PRP have DT ultimate myopic : Australia , DT exceptional country , outside DT stream of history and , dare PRP be VBN , DT inconveniences of NN . With some 11,000 NNS warning IN NN NNP “ clearly and unequivocally faces a NN emergency ” , some sense of PRP was registered on DT Australian political scene , if only barely . DT “ NNP NNPS ’ Warning of a NN Emergency ” published in BioScience does not shy away from DT language of catastrophe and emergency . “ Despite 40 NNS of JJ NN negotiations … PRP have generally conducted business as usual and have largely failed to address this predicament . ” NN NN had not merely arrived but bulldozed itself into recognition , “ accelerating faster than JJ NNS expected . ” DT authors and signatories suggest IN , “ An immense increase of scale in endeavours to conserve our biosphere is needed to avoid untold suffering due to DT NN crisis . ” JJ debates on DT subject of NN NN had mostly focused on JJ surface temperature , a clearly inadequate approach WDT avoids “ DT breath of human activities and DT real dangers stemming from a VBG NN . ” Areas of urgent redress were RB suggested . NN efficiency and a reduction in DT use of fossil fuels are high on DT list . “ PRP need a carbon - free economy WDT explicitly addresses human dependence on DT biosphere and policies WDT guide JJ decisions accordingly . ” DT call for a NN of language is encouraged : rhetoric of GDP growth and affluence needs to be replaced by sustainability “ and improving human well - being by prioritizing basic needs and reducing inequality . ” Not exactly music for DT muscular fossil fuel lobby . Another song sheet WDT MD not have impressed DT fossil fuel industries was an event WDT barely disturbed DT press releases . This month , DT National Electricity Market in Australia received a contribution from wind , solar and hydro NN amounting to half of DT total NN production . Rooftop solar contributions came in at 23.7 percent , with wind ( 15.7 percent ) , large - scale solar ( 8.8 percent ) and hydro ( 1.9 percent ) bringing up DT rear . With DT release of DT report , Australia braced itself for DT incinerating fury of bush fires WDT have arrived earlier this season . DT NN of NNP South Wales is anticipating what DT Rural Fire Services Commissioner Shane Fitzsimmons describes as “ DT most dangerous bushfire week this nation has ever seen ” . DT warnings were already pressing through DT policy pipeline in DT last decade . DT National Inquiry on Bushfire Mitigation and Management ’s 2004 report to DT Council of Australian NNP warned IN , “ Fires ’ frequency , intensity and size are expected to increase under NN NN as temperatures rise , rainfall variability increases , droughts become more severe and ecosystem dynamics alter , resulting in changed biomass fuel loads and types . ” DT authors of DT report VBP on to suggest IN “ projected hotter , drier and windier conditions associated with NN NN caused by greenhouse NN MD extend DT period of fuel drying and increase rates of fire spread . ” Earlier this NN , former NSW Fires Chief Greg Mullins and 22 other emergency honchos warned Prime Minister Morrison of DT dangers WDT MD face Australia this summer , suggesting IN DT NN meet to discuss some form of action against risks of conflagration . DT meeting has yet to take place , leaving such politicians as Adam Bandt , DT Greens MP for Melbourne , certain IN Morrison “ bears some responsibility and must apologise to DT communities impacted ” . Various Australian politicians , as then , were having none of PRP . Charged with DT task of keeping a plunderer ’s lifestyle in perpetuity , DT well - fed pigs in clover , DT following words of DT BioScience report sit uncomfortably with members of DT Morrison NN . “ DT NN crisis is closely linked to excessive consumption of DT wealthy lifestyle . DT most affluent NNS are mainly responsible for DT historical GHG NNS and generally have DT greatest per capita NNS . ” DT Deputy Prime Minister Michael McCormack preferred some tea and sympathy in responding to DT victims of DT fires , not policy and prognosis . “ PRP do n’t need DT ravings of some pure enlightened and woke capital city greenies at this NN when PRP are trying to save their homes . ” McCormack ’s primary target was DT Green party itself , which he accused of fiddling politically while Australia burned . “ DT ’s what Adam Bandt , and DT Greens , and Richard Di Natale , and all those other inner-city raving lunatics – and quite frankly , DT ’s how he was carrying on yesterday – DT ’s what PRP VBP , PRP ’re not VBG to VB down DT path . ” Other politicians have adopted a similar approach : DT now is what matters , and never mind previous failings and future disasters . NSW Premier Gladys Berejikilian provided DT stellar example . “ For any of PRP on DT ground , speaking to NNS traumatised , speaking to NNS fighting fires for weeks … VB exactly what DT priorities should be , and DT is saving life and property ” . NN NN , in other words , was something for another day , another slot in DT packed meeting schedule . Morrison reiterated DT position . He was “ focused on DT needs of DT NNS ” . He spoke of having “ firefighters out RB saving someone else ’s house while their own house is burning down , and when PRP are in DT sort of situation , DT is where attention must be . ” Mayors from DT areas most affected by DT recent conflagration have been crankily unimpressed by DT platitudes . NN NN literature , PRP surmise , is being assiduously avoided by DT NN . DT unfortunately named Carol Sparks , Mayor of Glen Innes , site of two deaths over DT weekend , suggested IN McCormack needed “ to read DT NN , and DT is what I am VBG by , is DT NN . ” Forget , suggested DT mayor , DT politics here . NN had imposed its cold , objective hand on DT matter . Mid Coast Mayor Claire Pontin was similarly riled , notably by suggestions IN fires were DT staple of Australian life and landscape . “ PRP ’ve not had situations IN DT . Fifty NNS ago , this MD never happen . ” EX are few incentives for humanity to adapt than through DT infliction of catastrophic conditions . Pandemics , NN wars and existential risk have done their bit in propelling NN . But luxury produces complacency ; well fed bellies induce sloth . Come DT writing of humanity ’s extensive biography of preying on DT NN , Australia and its political classes will have much to answer for . text: DT NN MD have already crossed nine key " tipping points " WDT will lead to catastrophic NN NN , NNS warn . " DT growing threat of rapid , irreversible changes means PRP is no longer responsible to wait and see , " Professor Lenton VBD . " DT situation is urgent and PRP need an emergency response . " A tipping point is reached when certain impacts of JJ NN become unstoppable , such as heavy NN loss in Antarctica . Among DT nine tipping points outlined by NNS were thawing of permafrost in Russia , large - scale die - offs of coral and a slowdown of ocean currents in DT Atlantic . Due to DT way our NN 's ecosystem is connected , as each tipping point is reached , others not currently active are pushed closer to DT brink . NNP has heated by around 1C since pre-industrial temperatures , a figure WDT is certain to rise in DT coming decades . However , current national NNS pledges – even if PRP are met – MD lead to 3C of NN . Professor Lenton added : " PRP might already have crossed DT threshold for a cascade of inter-related tipping points . text: NN NN is DT biggest challenge facing humanity today . DT associated JJ NN and humidification , increases in DT severity and frequency of extreme NN events , extension of DT ranges of vector ‐borne diseases , and DT consequent social and JJ stresses and disruption will have major negative consequences on JJ aspects of NN care . NNS whose resilience to NN is already impaired MD suffer disproportionately from these environmental changes , which are of unprecedented reach and magnitude . EX has been little connection made so far between NN NN and epilepsy . PRP briefly review DT history of NN NN NN and DT subsequent response of DT JJ scientific community . PRP consider how NN NN effects might in general affect NN and NN . PRP consider some of DT underlying complex interactions WDT , for example , favor DT spread of vector ‐borne diseases and how NN models operate and MD help plan for JJ and local changes . PRP then speculate specifically on how these generic ideas MD apply specifically to epilepsy . PRP consider these impacts at levels from molecular to DT epidemiological . Data are sparse , and EX is undoubtedly a need for more information to enable better estimation of possible effects of NN NN on care in epilepsy . PRP RB consider how DT professional activities of those involved in epilepsy NN care might contribute to JJ carbon NNS , for example , through flying for conference attendance . Healthcare organizations across DT NN are already considering , and responding to , JJ of these issues . PRP argue for more research in this area , but RB for action today . Actions today are likely to generate cobenefits for NN care , including care in epilepsy , resulting from efforts to decarbonize , mitigate effects of NN NN WDT has already happened , and plan for adaptation to NN NN . NN NN , dominated by NN NN , is accepted by DT majority of informed authorities as a clear feature of DT Anthropocene era , and is becoming DT lived experience shared by JJ of PRP globally , as PRP comment with increasing frequency about DT unseasonal weather and DT environment transforming around PRP . DT effects of NN NN will be pervasive , with no sphere of human endeavor likely to be untouched . As DT 5th assessment report from DT Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP ( IPCC ) VBZ : “ Continued emission of greenhouse gases will cause further NN and long ‐lasting changes in all components of DT NN system , increasing DT likelihood of severe , pervasive and irreversible impacts for NNS and ecosystems . Limiting NN NN MD require substantial and sustained reductions in greenhouse gas NNS which , together with adaptation , can limit NN NN risks . ” 1 DT risks to human NN posed by NN NN have already received extensive attention . DT fourth edition , published in 2018 , of DT Lancet Countdown on NN and NN NN stated NN NN was “ DT biggest JJ NN threat of DT 21st century , ” warning IN failure to take action MD lead to disasters WDT “ disrupt core JJ NN infrastructure and overwhelm NN services . ” 2 A further Lancet commission report details DT interaction between significant healthcare challenges ( a “ syndemic ” ) , working as multipliers WDT exacerbate unitary JJ challenges , such as obesity , undernutrition , and NN NN . 3 Several authorities and organizations have launched programs around DT effects of NN NN . DT NNP NNP and NNP Alliance , formed in 2011 , “ works to tackle NN NN and to protect and promote JJ NN ” and provides useful links and resources ( http://climateandhealthalliance.org/). Several international groups , nations , and regions have their own healthcare initiatives focused on NN NN , such as DT NNP Society Consortium on NNP and NNP in DT NNP NNPS ( https://medsocietiesforclimatehealth.org/), DT UK NNP Alliance on NNP NNP ( http://www.ukhealthalliance.org/), Doctors for DT Environment Australia ( https://www.dea.org.au/), DT Regional Institute of NNP Medicine and Research ( Rajasthan , India ) ( http://www.rihmr.org/), DT European Environment and NNP Youth Coalition ( http://www.eehyc.org/), and DT UK NHS ( https://www.sduhealth.org.uk/policy-strategy/reporting/nhs-carbon-footprint.aspx), carbon NNS from which are estimated to account for between 4 % and 6 % of DT total UK carbon footprint . DT NNP NNP Organization has made clear DT NN benefits of mitigating NN NN far outweigh DT costs . 4 DT NNP healthcare provider Kaiser Permanente announced in 2018 IN PRP MD become carbon neutral by 2020.5 Funders are increasingly supporting research into DT NN effects of NN NN , typically with a focus on mitigation strategies . PRP seems unlikely IN any human NN area will escape DT pervasive anticipated and unforeseen consequences of NN NN . Noting IN DT epilepsies are strongly influenced by environmental factors , PRP wished to start to consider how NN NN might affect DT epilepsies , to raise awareness within DT epilepsy community of these issues , and to facilitate and promote efforts by NNS affected by epilepsy , families and carers , and epilepsy professionals , to begin to address what action PRP can take . Individuals MD already be taking steps in their own private lives , for example , by working out their own carbon footprint ( https://footprint.wwf.org.uk/#/ ‐ a very easy to use and enlightening tool ) and taking effective actions . 6 Patients , clinicians , and NNS across DT NN , as a community , MD have ideas and initiatives for shared observations and mitigation measures to reduce DT potential added burden of NN NN for those with epilepsy . PRP here consider DT history of NN NN , review DT current NN of NN and JJ efforts to tackle NN NN , describe how NN NN can affect human NN and NN , and then address DT particular impacts RB MD be on DT epilepsies , how NN care in DT epilepsies might contribute to NN NN , what can be done to mitigate DT effects , and how progress might be achieved . 2 NN NN : A BRIEF SURVEY OF DT HISTORY AND CURRENT STATUS NN NN NN has a much longer history than most NNS realize , dating back to DT 19th century when Joseph Fourier recognized IN DT NNP 's atmosphere kept DT NN warmer than MD be DT case in a vacuum . He effectively discovered DT greenhouse effect : DT passage of visible light waves through DT atmosphere to DT NN 's surface , their absorption , and re‐emission as infrared radiation , which can then be absorbed by certain types of gases in DT atmosphere , increasing surface temperatures . Eunice Newton Foote was DT first to suggest IN DT NN effect of DT sun MD be increased in DT presence of carbon dioxide ( CO : then called “ carbonic acid ” ) . Her work was presented by Professor Joseph Henry at DT American Association for DT Advancement of NNP meeting in August 1856 . John Tyndall then examined DT absorption of infrared radiation in different gases , discovering DT greenhouse gases ( GHG ) CO , methane , and NN vapor in 1859 . Swedish scientist Svante Arrhenius was DT first to link human activity to JJ NN . In 1896 , he published “ On DT Influence of Carbonic Acid in DT Air upon DT Temperature of DT NNP , ” calculating IN a doubling of atmospheric CO ( now called DT “ NN sensitivity ” ) MD give a total NN of 5 ‐6 °C . In later work , he revised this downward to 4°C.7 This is not dissimilar to DT range reported by DT IPCC ’s 5th Assessment Report from DT latest generation of JJ NN models . Events then jump almost 100 NNS to DT modern era when DT first conference on NN NN , a joint NNP Nations Environment Programme ( UNEP ) / NNP Meteorological Organization ( WMO ) / International Council for NNP ( ICSU ) Conference on DT " Assessment of DT Role of Carbon Dioxide and Other Greenhouse Gases in NNP Variations and Associated Impacts , " in 1985 concluded IN GHG " are expected " to cause significant NN in DT next century . This led to DT establishment of DT Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP ( IPCC ) in 1988 , whose role is to “ assess DT scientific , technical and socio‐economic information relevant for DT understanding of DT risk of human‐induced NN NN , ” and DT NNP Nations Framework Convention on NNP NNP ( UNFCCC ) , an international environmental treaty adopted on NNP 9 , 1992 . DT IPCC has issued a series of Assessment Reports once every 5 ‐6 NNS — published in 1990 ( First Assessment Report : FAR ) , 1995 ( Second Assessment Report : SAR ) , 2001 ( Third Assessment Report : TAR ) , 2007 ( Fourth Assessment Report : AR4 ) , and 2013 / 2014 ( Fifth Assessment Report : AR5 ) — and supplemental and special topic reports WDT describe DT NN of scientific understanding at DT NN each report is prepared . Although EX have now been five Assessment Reports ( and DT 6th is under construction ) , DT range of potential NN with a doubling of atmospheric CO has not changed substantially from DT estimate made with quite simple NN models in DT FAR , or indeed by Arrhenius in 1896 , with both DT FAR and AR5 suggesting a range from 1.5 to 4.5°C . Alongside this , DT UNFCCC objective is to " stabilize greenhouse gas concentrations in DT atmosphere at a level WDT MD prevent dangerous anthropogenic interference with DT NN system . " DT framework sets nonbinding limits on GHG NNS for individual NNS , with no enforcement mechanisms . An annual Conference of DT Parties ( COP ) assesses progress in dealing with NN NN , and these have occurred since 1995 , with JJ producing specific international treaties ( “ agreements ” or “ protocols ” ) around GHG NNS . This history includes ( a ) DT Kyoto protocol — a legally binding agreement WDT industrialized NNS will reduce their NNS of GHGs , adopted in 1997 in Kyoto , Japan ; ( b ) DT Copenhagen Accord ( 2009 ) , which recognized NN NN as CD of DT greatest challenges of DT present day and suggested actions should be taken to keep temperature increases to below 2 °C ; however , DT document was not legally binding and does not contain any binding commitments for reducing CO NNS ; ( c ) DT Durban Platform ( 2011 ) , which included a decision to adopt a legally binding treaty on NN NN ; DT treaty terms were to be set out by 2015 and become effective in 2020 and for DT first NN , PRP included developing NNS and DT NNP NNPS ; and ( d ) DT Paris Agreement ( 2015 ) was a NN NN accord agreed by ~200 NNS in December 2015 WDT came into force on November 4 , 2016 , committing NN leaders to keeping JJ NN below 2 °C and pursuing a tougher target of 1.5°C . Carbon emission curbs are not legally binding , but DT framework of DT accord , including a mechanism for periodically increasing pledges , is binding . Since DT FAR , DT understanding of human influence on NN has improved through better NN observations and NN system modeling , with DT AR5 stating IN : ( a ) “ NN of DT NN system is unequivocal , and since DT 1950s , JJ of DT observed changes are unprecedented over decades to millennia " 8 ; ( b ) " Atmospheric concentrations of carbon dioxide , methane , and nitrous oxide have increased to levels unprecedented in at least DT last 800 000 NNS " 8 ; and ( c ) “ Human influence on DT NN system is clear … PRP is extremely likely ( 95% ‐100 % probability ) IN human influence was DT dominant cause of JJ NN between 1951 ‐2010 . ” 8 Special reports such as DT recent SR159 ( JJ NN of 1.5 °C ) examined DT difference in impacts between 1.5 and 2 °C NN , suggesting IN limiting NN to 1.5 °C “ is possible within DT laws of chemistry and physics but doing so MD require unprecedented changes ” with “ ‘ rapid and far ‐reaching ’ transitions in land , NN , industry , buildings , transport , and cities . ” A 1.5 °C limit MD require JJ net anthropogenic CO NNS to decline by about 45 % from 2010 levels by 2030 , reaching net zero around 2050 . To limiting JJ NN to below 2°C , CO NNS will need to decline by about 20 % by 2030 and reach net zero around 2075 . PRP are already living in a 1 °C warmer NN . DT SR159 NNS “ PRP are already seeing DT consequences of 1 °C of JJ NN through more extreme weather , rising NN levels and diminishing Arctic NN NN , among other changes … By 2100 , JJ NN level rise MD be 10 cm lower with JJ NN of 1.5 °C compared with 2 °C , ” ; and moreover , “ JJ NN is likely to reach 1.5 °C between 2030 and 2052 if PRP continues to increase at DT current rate ( high confidence ) . ” If PRP continue on our current emission trajectory , then PRP are likely to reach 2.6‐4.8 °C NN by 2100 , with recent modeling results suggesting IN DT higher NN sensitivities MD be more likely . In terms of personal emission targets , average personal NNS in 2010 were around 5 tons per person and to reach DT 2 °C target MD require reduction to around 1.5 tons by 2050.10 This is very ambitious and of is of course based on an equal sharing of NNS across DT JJ population . In reality , DT rich , Westernized nations use much more carbon per person than DT poorer nations . 10 EX is DT potential for major reduction in personal carbon footprints in DT Western NN typically by reducing DT major contributors of car travel , heating , electricity use , and flying . Existing variability in weather influences human NN . For example , during clear summer days EX is an increased occurrence of sunburn and Lyme NN , while during DT winter , EX is increased influence of influenza and falls . As NN NN will influence weather , particularly weather extremes , then impacts on human NN are likely . Hence , EX has been an interest in DT likely influence of NN NN on human NN for over 30 NNS , with a significant body of work now available on DT NN impacts of NN NN . 11 - 15 NN NN MD lead to multiple NN impacts acting through a variety of different pathways , as shown conceptually in Figure 1 . Pathways through which NN NN MD influence NN . NN NN will affect mean weather , such as rainfall amounts and temperature . In addition to changing average conditions , PRP MD RB increase variability and extremes ( eg , more intense rainfall events ) . DT latter is probably of most consequence for human NN . Although globally , interannual temperature has not increased in variability , 16 EX is evidence of regional changes in extremes , 17,18 as both DT mean NN and NN variability shift in response to anthropogenic forcings ( Figure 2 ) . These shifts in weather will be moderated by local environmental conditions and human adaptation , leading to changes in three broad categories of exposure WDT have DT potential to influence NN . DT first are direct effects such as DT influence of a heatwave upon mortality . CD DT second are indirect exposures such as changing weather altering DT growing season and distribution of plants , affecting pollen production , which in turn impacts on allergic disease20 ; other examples include changing weather patterns affecting mosquito breeding and life cycles , leading to changes in malaria and dengue fever ( see below ) . 21 Changes in temperature and humidity alter DT geography of vector ‐borne diseases , by shifting vector breeding sites22 and altering DT transmission windows of vector ‐borne diseases . 23 In JJ NNS , more data are needed to characterize DT relationships between vector , pathogen , and NN . 24,25 Third , NN NN MD act through JJ and social disruption , for example , leading to mental NN effects from extreme events such as flooding26 or influencing JJ crop yields leading to increased hunger . 27 Flooding , whether coastal , fluvial , or pluvial , carries direct risks of drowning28 as well as a range of NN risks in DT aftermath of DT event , including DT spread of NN ‐borne diseases , 29 and DT spread of microbial contaminants in buildings . 30 DT risk of exacerbating existing JJ conditions , through disrupted access to medicines and JJ facilities , is RB a concern . Schematic showing DT effect on extreme temperatures when ( A ) DT mean temperature increases , ( B ) DT variance increases , and ( C ) when both DT mean and variance increase for a normal distribution of temperature However , changing exposure to extreme weather does not automatically lead to NN impacts , and DT gray box in Figure 1 highlights DT important moderating influence WDT NN care and wider JJ NN capability can have in ameliorating potential impacts . Put simply , appropriate NN care and JJ NN input can reduce NN impacts . PRP is important to recognize IN these capabilities are dynamic over NN . Furthermore , PRP can respond ( ie , adapt ) to JJ situations . CD prominent example of such an adaptation occurred in response to DT 2003 European heatwave during which over 70 000 additional deaths were recorded . CD City dwellers are at particular risk of heat stress given DT urban heat island effect . 31 Modeling suggests IN in summer 2003 , when an estimated 735 NNS died of causes relating to extreme heat in central Paris , anthropogenic NN NN increased DT risk of heat ‐related mortality by approximately 70%,32 illustrating DT scale of DT issue . In response , JJ European NNS developed early warning systems for heatwaves and national advice and guidelines on adaptation to reduce potential NN impacts . 33 Adapting JJ NN capabilities will play an important role in responding to NN NN . DT arrows in Figure 1 indicate feedback mechanisms between societal infrastructure , JJ NN , and adaptation measures and NN NN . Measures to reduce NN impacts MD RB reduce GHG NNS . Examples include DT NN and environmental cobenefits of low carbon diets . 34,35 Much of our understanding of likely impacts from NN NN in DT coming decades comes from NN models . Atmosphere ‐Ocean General Circulation Models ( AOGCMs ) 36 use DT laws of physics to compute atmospheric , oceanic , and other environmental variables , and represent different processes and interactions in DT NN system , at a series of evenly spaced “ cells ” or unit areas around DT globe . Although important tools in our understanding , PRP are complex and require considerable computational resource to run . For this reason , DT cells used by NN ‐of ‐the‐art JJ NN models typically span a large area in order to reduce DT number of calculations required : in turn , DT outputs generated are coarse . While these outputs are useful for identifying JJ and regional trends , PRP need to adapt them for local use ( eg , to assess DT likely impacts of NN NN in a particular coastal city or tropical community ) . This is accomplished using “ downscaling ” methods , 37,38 which involve using either statistical approaches or a higher resolution model over a limited area to add greater detail . 39,40 Unlike short‐term weather forecasts , which are dependent on DT initial NN of DT atmosphere , longer ‐term projections from NN models are largely dependent on trajectories of JJ development and on how fluctuating concentrations of GHGs impact DT balance of sunlight absorbed by DT NNP and NN radiated back into space . Thus , these longer ‐term projections are subject to substantial uncertainty not related to DT NN system . In DT most recent model simulations , these trajectories are characterized by DT representative concentration pathways ( RCPs ) , 41 a comprehensive dataset of changes to DT NNP 's NN balance under different possible futures . However , even when models are run with DT same RCP , intermodel variability arises due to differences in how models represent processes , leading to different projected future NN NNS . For this reason , a multimodel ensemble is often used , in which uncertainty is considered to be represented by DT spread of model projections . DT various choices and inferences made at each stage of DT modeling process can therefore yield a substantial envelope of uncertainty in local impacts . Yet , despite these uncertainties , consistent findings with relevance for epilepsy emerge . For instance , models agree exceptionally well on estimates of heat stress metrics , which combine temperature and humidity . 42 Furthermore , each generation of models represents an advance in our understanding of NN processes and a refinement of modeled processes . For example , for a number of extreme temperature indices , DT spread among DT most recent Coupled Model Intercomparison Project Phase 5 models ( CMIP5 ; CMIP is a collaborative framework for supporting assessments of NN NN and fostering model development , in which international modeling groups perform simulations based on preagreed scientific objectives , generating a database of model outputs with common standards ) is less than DT spread among DT previous generation CMIP3 models , even though DT project now contains more models . 43 DT burden of JJ of these changes will be felt by those least equipped to adapt . Models project increases in temperature variability in Amazonia , Southern Africa , DT Sahel , India , and South ‐East Asia over DT coming decades . 44 In India , models RB indicate an intensification of heatwaves , with areas WDT do not currently experience heatwaves becoming severely affected this century . 45 Thus , models can help PRP understand where PRP can expect DT effects of NN NN to be most marked and what those effects might be , in turn helping PRP plan for DT likely challenges WDT will need to be addressed for NN care in general , and epilepsy in particular . As DT NN changes , PRP can expect EX to be particular implications for epilepsy . These impacts might manifest at DT level of altered risk of epilepsy per se , altered risk of seizures in established epilepsy , consequences for epilepsy treatments , and outcomes , with effects more likely to affect those not favored in DT first place by geography and economics . PRP can expect inequalities in epilepsy NN care to be further exacerbated . NN NN leads to spread of vectors for infections , which is already being reported , and more can be anticipated . NN ‐driven hyperthermia , fevers , food and NN stress , and starvation MD further compound other difficulties as well as being directly relevant themselves . Moreover , while humans are remarkably adaptable and have found niches in almost every terrestrial environment , NN NN will superimpose unprecedented rates and types of NN . A number of vector ‐borne infections can cause epilepsy or seizures in DT acute phase . Chikungunya NN infection is associated with seizures as part of a multisystem acute illness in 10 % of patients , 46 while EX are case reports of epilepsy as part of DT chronic sequelae of neonatal chikungunya encephalitis .47 Epilepsia partialis continua has been reported with dengue encephalitis.48 Vertical Zika NN infection can lead to epilepsy even in DT absence of microcephaly , 49 and DT epilepsy is typically drug‐resistant . 50 If NN NN leads to a spread of DT vector carrying DT infectious agent , then EX will be an accompanying risk of spread of infection ‐related epilepsy or acute seizures . Predictions are difficult , because DT impact of NN NN on vectors is multifactorial , and MD be further compounded by multiplier effects as well as actions taking to mitigate its effects . PRP is already DT case IN DT NN ‐sensitive diseases affect DT poorest populations DT most , with higher prevalence and greater mortality , for several reasons . 51 Outbreaks of vector ‐borne infections can easily overwhelm healthcare systems , for example , as shown by recent outbreaks of Ebola and Zika viruses , and emergence of infections in naïve populations or those WDT have lost immunity can be even more dangerous . JJ factors related to NN NN can alter vector ranges , survival , biting behavior , pathogen infection capacity , and thus ultimately DT risk of NN in humans . Changes in rainfall patterns , drought‐rain cycles , and flood magnitude and frequency can all have effects , while human strategies to combat NN NN , such as reestablishment of wetlands and green spaces , can , perversely , promote vector spread . Accounting for these effects in model simulations is particularly challenging , but preliminary studies suggest , for example , IN NN NN will favor DT spread of dengue fever and other arthropod ‐borne infections given DT temperature sensitivity of JJ factors favoring DT spread of infection . 52 Environmental , especially urban , effects of NN NN might lead to DT spread of cysticercosis,53 neurological involvement from which is a major cause of epilepsy globally . A NN focusing on DT risk of spread of vector ‐borne NN in DT UK resulting from NN NN suggests IN a 1 °C rise in temperature MD permit Chikungunya NN transmission for 1‐3 months of DT NN across most of southeast England by 2071 ‐2100 , with changes in transmission ranges RB found for a range of other arthropods . 52 Malaria is caused by five species of Plasmodium transmitted by Anopheles mosquitoes . In malaria‐endemic areas , up to 90 % of DT population MD have parasites detectable in their blood . Plasmodium falciparum and Plasmodium vivax are associated with seizures and epilepsy , 54 particularly seizures during acute infections , and development of epilepsy has been documented following severe falciparum malaria . In addition , EX is evidence IN asymptomatic malaria parasitemia can precipitate seizures in those with epilepsy . 55 EX are JJ models of DT effect of NN NN on DT transmission of malaria , with DT most significant and consistent effects predicted to occur in DT highlands in Africa and parts of South America and South ‐East Asia .56 In other regions , DT effect of NN NN on malaria transmission MD be minimal due to improved control measures and socioeconomic factors , although DT present decline in malaria transmission across DT NN depends on continued support for DT current control measures . However , significant uncertainties exist in these models , particularly in DT areas WDT experience malaria epidemics . Furthermore , most of these models examined DT effect of NN NN on mosquitoes WDT carry P falciparum , but PRP is DT Anopheles species WDT transmit P vivax ( particularly Anopheles atroparvus ) WDT are most likely to increase seizures and epilepsy in Europe . 57 For example , in CD model , a medium ‐high scenario of NN NN predicts IN DT southern half of Great Britain will be climatically suitable for P vivax malaria transmission by 2030 and by 2080 even southern Scotland will be climatically suitable for 2 months of DT NN . 58 Phenomena other than infections are RB worsening with NN NN . As conflicts arise , PRP can expect more head injuries as another cause of epilepsy . A NN from a highly polluted city in NNP suggests IN transient increases in air pollutants such as nitrogen dioxide and sulfur dioxide are associated with increased hospital visits for epilepsy , supporting findings from another NN from Chile WDT reported an increased risk of hospitalization for epilepsy with increases in air pollutants . 59 Another NN identified a tentative link between higher relative air humidity and an increased risk of admission for an epileptic seizure ( though higher ambient temperature was associated with a lower risk ) . 60 These are preliminary studies WDT suggest DT relationships , if correct , are complex with a need for more data . But , EX is certainly a prevailing view IN DT outlook strongly favors strategies to forestall NN NN rather than trying to deal with DT consequences on epilepsy and seizures of DT complicated environmental changes WDT will occur due to NN NN . Temperature can affect genes and proteins . Most genetic epilepsies are due to dysfunctional channels . As in much of epilepsy genetics , SCN1A is among DT best studied in this regard . Some mutations in SCN1A WDT can cause epilepsy lead to defective folding of DT encoded channel : Mutant channel insertion into a cell surface is temperature ‐sensitive , for example , with increased insertion and current density at 30 °C compared to 37°C.61 Mutations in SCN1A can cause DT rare , severe developmental and epileptic encephalopathy Dravet syndrome . While DT effect of such dynamic changes in DT context of prolonged periods of higher ambient temperature in thermoregulating humans is difficult to predict , empirical and modeling data show direct effects of higher temperatures on sodium channel biophysical properties and neuronal dynamics . 62 Elevated ambient temperatures due to hot baths increase seizure frequency in Dravet syndrome . 63 Anecdotally , DT UK Dravet syndrome patient support group reported IN during DT sustained atypical high ambient temperatures of DT summer of 2018 , affected NNS experienced more seizures and greater lethargy , in keeping with survey data from DT Netherlands . 64 PRP previously reported DT death of a young patient with Dravet syndrome who had been seizure ‐free , but had been walking outside on DT hottest day in Melbourne ( Australia ) for NNS , with a peak of 46.5°C.65 EX are other temperature ‐sensitive epilepsies , though generally less well studied . An epilepsy ‐related mutation in SCN8A was associated with temperature ‐sensitive protein expression and function . 66 Other genetic epilepsies with fever ‐induced seizures include those due to certain mutations in DT genes GABRG2 , CHD2 , STX1B : Temperature elevation can affect brain thermal regulation and epileptiform discharges and induce seizures in models carrying certain mutations in GABRG2 67 or STX1B .68 Moreover , seizures in JJ epilepsies , of all types , are more frequent with psychological stress . NN NN is projected to increase population stress levels as PRP will affect mean NN , such as rainfall amounts and temperature , but RB weather variability and extremes , probably of most consequence for human NN . EX has been little research into DT effects of NN NN on treatments for epilepsy . Lorazepam , used in JJ parts of DT NN as an emergency treatment for seizures , is especially prone to degradation with higher mean kinetic temperature . 69 EX are few data on other antiepileptic drugs ( AEDs ) , and DT summary of product characteristics for several commonly used AEDs do not include specific temperature recommendations , while , for example , phenobarbital tablets should be stored below 25°C.70 Medication supply chains can be compromised even today : PRP is easy to see how disruption to infrastructure MD threaten AED ( and indeed any drug ) supply , as indeed happened after an exemplar ( but not NN NN ‐related ) disruption in a highly organized , well ‐developed economy in DT Great East Japan earthquake of 2011.71 In addition , biodiversity loss is a feature of NN NN : This MD compromise sources , such as plant , microbial , and fungal species , from which DT next antiepileptic drugs might emerge ( see Figure 3 ) . Example of a zebrafish behavioral assay showing anticonvulsant activity of a plant extract typically used for ethnomedicinal purposes to treat seizures in Cameroon . Zebrafish larvae were pretreated with DT ethanolic plant extract ( 25 µg / mL ) for 18 h before acute exposure to pentylenetetrazol ( 20 mmol / L ) . Pentylenetetrazol ‐induced convulsive ‐like behavior was measured 5 min after , using an automated video‐tracking device . Graph shows total distance traveled by larvae in millimeters per 5 ‐min interval during a 30 ‐min tracking session . Data were analyzed using specialized software to quantify total larval movements and subjected to two ‐way with repeated ‐measures ANOVA , followed by Bonferroni 's post hoc test ( n = 10 ‐ 12/ group ) . *** P <.001 , *P <.05 ( vs Veh + veh ) , ###P <.001 , # P <.05 ( vs Veh + PTZ ) . EXT , extract ; PTZ , pentylenetetrazol ; Veh , vehicle . Note : Total distance traveled by PTZ ‐treated larvae is lower at later NN intervals as larvae reach DT equivalent of status epilepticus at this stage and are less able to move due to loss of posture — therefore accounting for lack of statistical significance between extract ‐treated larvae Moreover , poverty is associated with reduced access to NN care , with DT majority of NNS in DT NN today with epilepsy having no access to any AEDs . Most NN NN projections anticipate IN poverty is likely to increase , with disproportionate effects for those already most vulnerable . Thus , PRP can anticipate IN DT negative influence of epilepsy on socioeconomic status and all ‐cause risk of premature mortality will grow with NN NN independent of any direct effect on epilepsy biology . 7 WHAT CAN THOSE INVOLVED IN EPILEPSY DO ? Measures to address NN NN MD include attempts to reduce carbon NNS , and actions for mitigation and adaptation . 1 For epilepsy professionals , EX MD be steps WDT be included in daily practice . Raising awareness of NN NN , its impact for NNS with epilepsy and our contributions to NN NN is a start — DT very purpose of this article . Concurrently , more research is required to investigate into NN NN and epilepsy , to better define DT risks and develop adaptations and mitigations . Reduction of carbon NNS ( “ decarbonizing ” ) MD begin with understanding DT sources of carbon NNS at DT individual level and monitoring of individual carbon contributions , for both professionals and NNS with epilepsy . Personal and SME carbon NNS calculators are available online ( examples include : https://www.carbonfootprint.com/calculator.aspx; https://footprint.wwf.org.uk/#/; https://www.carbontrust.com/resources/tools/carbon-footprint-calculator/). Among DT key contributors for most NNS as professionals will be travel , consumption of food and goods , NN equipment , hotels , and restaurants , but this is not an exhaustive list and PRP invite other suggestions . Travel is likely to be a major contributor for JJ professionals and patients . Flying to conferences and meetings is likely to be an important component of contributions to NNS at DT personal professional level . Flying in classes other than economy increases NNS significantly , for several reasons ( eg , see http://blogs.worldbank.org/developmenttalk/blog-carbon-footprint-world-bank-group-staff-air-travel). Various websites , including some for academic travel in particular , can help NNS calculate , reduce , or mitigate NNS ( eg , www.flyingless.org and https://thepointsguy.com/guide/a-guide-to-airline-carbonoffset-programs/). This is a difficult area , as clinical and scientific advances and stronger collaborations do emerge from face ‐to ‐face meetings , and teleconferencing still lacks both DT personal touch and infallible reliability . But perhaps not every meeting is essential,65 and to achieve DT carbon emission reductions necessary to stabilize DT NN will require PRP to modify some current practices and find JJ ways to achieve DT same outcomes . Targeted distribution of mitigation measures ( eg , carbon offsetting ) for conference attendance to those nations most at risk from NN NN MD suit some conference attendees . Higher levels of sustainability at conferences should be considered : hotel usage , maintenance of ambient temperatures in conference halls and hotels ( and personal offices at work ) , and food and drink provision at meetings are all areas to be considered . JJ organizations will consider these difficult changes to make for meetings WDT often represent sources of income , but as with JJ aspects of NN NN , EX is a bigger picture to consider . NN NNS themselves have considered and addressed DT issue of conference travel ( https://noflyclimatesci.org/), even with a model for a “ nearly carbon ‐neutral conference . ” 74 More flying does not necessarily equate with greater academic success .75 Car journeys represent another area in which professionals and patients might both contribute , and actions such as telehealth initiatives MD be possible in some settings and jurisdictions , though information technology infrastructure , privacy , and regulatory issues MD present difficulties . Professionals can form powerful lobby groups and bring these issues to DT attention of their organizations . PRP must not be nihilistic . Actions at governmental , institutional , and personal levels are required and possible . For example , DT UK NNP Alliance on NNP NNP ( http://www.ukhealthalliance.org/) advocates “ for responses to NN NN WDT protect and promote JJ NN . ” Online tools are available for further ideas and implementation of adaptation measures ( eg , https://www.ukcip.org.uk/). Adaptations will be necessary and will need to be shaped by outcomes from research ( ideally shared across diseases ) , such as improved awareness and management of changes in vector ranges or medicine manufacture and distribution practice . Nondomestic contributions to NN NN exceed those of DT residential sector . Companies and institutions around DT NN are beginning to take action : DT behavior of employees , including epilepsy professionals , MD be overlooked in this process , but can be central to DT initiation , promotion , and success of programs designed to address NN NN . Asking employees to switch their computers off at DT end of DT day , for example , does not mean NNS will do DT . Professionals can , however , choose to take DT lead . Evidence shows IN NNS can be motivated as much by “ cobenefits ” ( such as JJ and scientific advancement ; or fostering a more moral and caring community ) as PRP are by concern about NN NN , whether PRP are convinced about DT occurrence of NN NN or not .76 Adaptations might include , for example , increased vigilance and preemptive changes in behavior against local extreme heat events for NNS with epilepsy due to heat ‐sensitive mutation ‐driven genetic epilepsies , informed by local ( downscaled ) modeling of future NN trends , or improved short‐term weather forecasting . As precision medicine initiatives become more popular , PRP MD envisage inclusion of NN NN parameters in individualized epilepsy management schemes . PRP summarize some suggestions for actions in Table 2 . Actions to consider regarding epilepsy and NN NN Increase information available on impact on NN NN on epilepsy and vice versa Collect data from NNS with epilepsy , own clinical practice Establish contact with local and national patient and carer support organizations ; gather data systematically Establish links with local NN NNS , consider local and regional factors ( eg , urban vs rural ) Changing patterns of seizures and comorbidities reported by NNS with epilepsy ; use of social NN and big data methods Included temperature and humidity parameters in experimental models ; quantification of stress and consequences in clinical trials ; stability of medications Join local , national , international initiatives for individuals and professionals ; calculate own carbon NNS at personal and professional levels Develop practice approaches WDT are more sustainable Consider changes with cobenefits to raise chances of engagement and success Consider travel options ; use freely available tools ; explore and engage with local NN service sustainability efforts ; lobby institutions , healthcare organizations , journals and conference organizers Consider measures WDT facilitate sustainable behavior — for example , earlier setting up of conferences to enable planning of more sustainable travel options Provide information and advice — for example , when heatwaves are expected ; promote telehealth where possible Switch off devices when not needed ; promote sustainable practices — for example , enable colleagues to attend meetings remotely , record talks for dissemination Promote sustainability for DT next generation Facilitate remote supervision and mentoring ; reduce dependence of academic progress upon less sustainable practices Clinicians have always considered prevention to be better than cure . Minimizing DT progress of NN NN and mitigating NNS now will be cheaper than taking actions later when DT situation has already gotten worse , although EX is already a need for some adaptation due to NN from historical NNS . DT challenge is huge , but PRP is incumbent upon PRP to do what PRP can : This is intrinsic to our commitment and duty to patient care and can be seen as part of DT aim of achieving JJ equality of NN care in epilepsy . NNS have managed huge challenges before — DT reduction in drink driving rates , DT reduced production of aerosols , and changes in behavior after DT HIV epidemic . With NN NN , DT challenge is bigger , more JJ , and more urgent , but everything counts . Schools , towns , local councils , and nations have declared NNS of “ NN emergency ” ( eg , https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-48126677), with a prominent role played by schoolchildren . Should and can a profession take action beyond virtue signaling ? And if so , what additional evidence do PRP need to do DT ? Or in fact can PRP not afford to wait ? PRP acknowledge DT links between epilepsy and NN NN PRP discuss are speculative , and more research is required . And , of course , anything PRP can do in our personal lives anyway can contribute to help counter CD of DT biggest challenges facing humanity and all life on this NN . PRP should perhaps finish with DT words of DT next generation , specifically Greta Thunberg ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greta aged 16 , speaking to members of DT European Parliament and European Union officials in Strasbourg on April 16 , 2019 , after DT disastrous fire at Notre Dame cathedral : “ PRP is still not too late to act . PRP will take a far ‐reaching vision , PRP will take courage , PRP will take fierce , fierce determination to act now , to lay DT foundations where PRP MD not VB all DT details about how to shape DT ceiling . In other words , PRP will take cathedral thinking . I ask PRP to please wake up and make changes required possible . ”

text: ( CNN ) Humans have damaged around a quarter of NN - free land on NNP , NNP Nations NNS warned in a major report Thursday , stressing IN further degradation must be stopped to prevent catastrophic JJ NN . text: NN activists and NN leaders have gathered this week in NNP York for DT NNP Nations NNP Summit . But on Wednesday attention was focused across DT Atlantic , where in Monaco DT UN ’s Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP presented a special report on DT “ unprecedented ” impact NN temperature will have on DT NN ’s oceans . PRP ’s not good . DT report — compiled by over 100 authors from 36 NNS citing close to 7,000 accredited sources — paints a grim picture of DT effect NN oceans and DT cryosphere will have on humanity , especially if nothing is done to curb NNS . DT ocean has played a critical role in warding off DT effects of NN NN by absorbing close to 25 percent of CO2 NNS . DT report warns IN as DT temperature continues to rise and DT ocean traps more heat , PRP will become more acidic , less oxygenated , less productive , less hospitable to life , and more likely to give rise to tropical storms and hurricanes , which will occur with greater frequency and intensity . DT report notes IN with any additional degree of NN , intense NN events WDT used to occur once per century will in certain regions once per NN by DT middle of DT 21st century . Connected to DT fate of DT NN ’s oceans is DT fate of DT NN ’s frozen areas , or DT cryosphere , on which close to 1.5 billion NNS ’s lives directs depend . As parts of DT cryosphere melt ( glaciers , for instance ) , DT JJ NN level will continue to rise , dramatically altering life for those living in coast regions , if not making those regions uninhabitable . DT NN level is rising twice as fast as PRP did during DT 20th century , and IN DT rate is increasing , DT report notes , explaining IN DT Antarctic NN sheet will contribute more to NN level rise by 2100 than was previously expected . In DT next 80 NNS , DT NN level MD increased by up to 60 centimeters if greenhouse gas NNS are dramatically reduced , and 110 centimeters if PRP are not . PRP is n’t just glaciers and rising NN levels , either . As permafrost , snow , and NN melt , DT frequency of landslides , avalanches , rockfalls , floods , and wildfires will increase . NN availability MD RB be thrown into flux as glaciers retreat , impacting agriculture . “ DT NN ’s ocean and cryosphere have been ‘ taking DT heat ’ from NN NN for decades , and consequences for nature and humanity are sweeping and severe , ” IPCC Vice Chair Ko Barett VBD in a statement . “ DT rapid changes to DT ocean and DT frozen parts of our NN are forcing NNS from coastal cities to remote Arctic communities to fundamentally alter their ways of life . ” In August , DT IPCC released a similarly dire report about DT impact DT NN crisis will have on DT JJ food supply . This extends well beyond traditional agriculture . DT report released Wednesday explains IN DT “ JJ catch potential ” for fish MD decrease as DT NN ocean becomes less hospitable to marine life , and IN communities WDT rely on seafood MD be in trouble . DT only answer is to cut CO2 NNS and work toward more sustainable solutions . “ Cutting greenhouse gas NNS will limit impacts on ocean ecosystems WDT provide PRP with food , support our NN and shape our cultures , ” IPCC Co-Chair Hans - Otto Pörtner , Co-Chair VBD in a statement . “ Reducing other pressures such as pollution will further help marine life deal with changes in their environment , while enabling a more resilient ocean . ” Despite DT realities detailed in DT report , PRP was structured around DT idea IN JJ of these consequences can be mitigated with “ timely , ambitious and coordinated action ” to reduce NNS and pursue sustainable development . Unfortunately for humanity , NNP and DT NNP NNPS , DT NN ’s two largest emitters of greenhouse gases , have largely ignored he NN crisis . text: Nearly 50 NNS ago , three chemists named Mario Molina , Sherwood Rowland and Paul Crutzen found evidence IN chlorofluorocarbons , chemicals known as CFCs and released from aerosol sprays , were weakening DT ozone layer WDT functions as DT NN ’s natural sunscreen protecting humans , animals and plants from harmful radiation . DT discovery made big NN and rattled DT NN . Aerosol sales dropped dramatically , and , despite pushback from DT chemical companies WDT made CFCs , Congress in 1977 added protecting DT ozone layer to DT Environmental Protection Agency ’s duties under DT Clean Air Act . Not long afterward , DT agency determined IN DT compounds , then widely used in refrigerators , air - conditioners and some industrial processes , posed an even graver threat to DT atmosphere than first thought . Soon after , pressure began to build for a phaseout of CFCs in DT NNP NNPS as well as for an international treaty to find alternatives . DT case for JJ action became ever more urgent in 1985 when a British team discovered a hole in DT ozone layer above Antarctica , followed by confirmation by NASA NNS of a connection between DT hole and CFCs . With DT rest of DT NN and even industry on board , DT result was DT 1987 Montreal Protocol , a landmark agreement banning chlorofluorocarbons and other ozone - depleting chemicals . End of story ? Not quite . As PRP happened , DT ozone - friendly replacements for DT CFCs , known as hydrofluorocarbons , turned out to be distinctly unfriendly to DT NN . So in 2016 , DT Montreal signatories reconvened in Kigali , Rwanda , and agreed to amend DT original protocol to phase out HFCs and find substitutes more friendly to DT atmosphere . DT bottom line is IN DT NN , confronted with two dire threats to DT NN ’s fragile atmosphere , found two planetary responses with positive outcomes . DT ozone layer is healing . DT ’s worth remembering as PRP struggle , often despairingly , to find common ground in DT battle against NN NN . Compared with DT manifold complexities of JJ NN , dealing with ozone depletion was , in fact , relatively simple . But DT key point is IN PRP happened , and PRP ’s worth asking why DT NN has not responded with similar resolve in dealing with DT main JJ NN gases IN carbon dioxide , about which PRP have known a lot for a long NN .

PRP took nearly a century of research and data to convince DT vast majority of DT scientific community IN human activity MD alter DT NN of our entire NN . In DT 1800s , experiments suggesting IN human - produced carbon dioxide ( CO2 ) and other gases MD collect in DT atmosphere and insulate NNP were met with more curiosity than concern . By DT late 1950s , CO2 readings MD offer some of DT first data to corroborate DT JJ NN theory . Eventually an abundance of data , along with NN modeling MD show not only IN JJ NN was real , but IN PRP RB presented a host of dire consequences . Dating back to DT ancient Greeks , JJ NNS had proposed IN humans MD VB temperatures and influence rainfall by chopping down trees , plowing fields or irrigating a desert . CD theory of NN effects , widely believed until DT Dust Bowl of DT 1930s , held IN “ rain follows DT plow , ” DT now - discredited idea IN tilling soil and other agricultural practices MD result in increased rainfall . Accurate or not , those perceived NN effects were merely local . DT idea IN humans MD somehow alter NN on a JJ scale MD seem far - fetched for centuries . In DT 1820s , French mathematician and physicist Joseph Fourier proposed IN NN reaching DT NN as sunlight must be balanced by NN returning to space since heated surfaces emit radiation . But some of DT NN , he reasoned , must be held within DT atmosphere and not return to space , keeping NNP warm . He proposed IN NNP ’s thin covering of air — its atmosphere — acts DT way a glass greenhouse MD . NN enters through DT glass walls , but is then trapped inside , much IN a warm greenhouse . Experts have since pointed out IN DT greenhouse analogy was an oversimplification , since outgoing infrared radiation is n’t exactly trapped by NNP ’s atmosphere but absorbed . DT more greenhouse gases EX are , DT more NN is kept within NNP ’s atmosphere . But DT so - called greenhouse effect analogy stuck and some 40 NNS later , Irish scientist John Tyndall MD start to explore exactly what kinds of gases were most likely to play a role in absorbing sunlight . His calculations showed IN if CO2 levels were halved , JJ temperatures MD decrease by about 5 degrees Celsius ( 9 degrees Fahrenheit ) . Next , Arrhenius wondered if DT reverse were true . Arrhenius returned to his calculations , this NN investigating what MD happen if CO2 levels were doubled . DT possibility seemed remote at DT NN , but his results suggested IN JJ temperatures MD increase by DT same amount — 5 degrees C or 9 degrees F . Decades later , modern NN modeling have confirmed IN Arrhenius ’ numbers were n’t far off DT mark . Back in DT 1890s , however , DT concept of VBG DT NN was remote and even welcomed . As Arrehenius wrote , “ By DT influence of DT increasing percentage of carbonic acid [ CO2 ] in DT atmosphere , PRP MD hope to enjoy ages with more equable and better climates , especially as regards DT colder regions of DT NN . ” By DT 1930s , at least CD scientist MD start to claim IN carbon NNS might already be having a NN effect . READ MORE : When NNP NNP Was Revealed by DT Keeling Curve In DT early 1970s , a different kind of NN worry took hold : JJ cooling . text: “ PRP just seems IN NNS have really lost their way , severed ties with reality completely , where PRP ’re listening to some pied piper online instead of really questioning authority . questioning DT power structures IN PRP should be all along ! ” – Abby Martin ( from this week ’s interview . ) “ I daresay PRP have n’t had much practice , ’ VBD DT Queen . ‘ When I was your age , I always did PRP for half - an - hour a day . Why , sometimes I ’ve believed as JJ as six impossible things before breakfast . ” – Lewis Carroll , Through DT Looking Glass [ 1 ] DT NN 2019 saw DT unfolding of a number of dramatic events . At DT beginning of DT NN , DT Venezuelan opposition orchestrated a coup , with dozens of NNS including a number of South American NNS recognizing opposition figure Juan Guaidó as NN . This attempt appears to have failed miserably as DT military and DT bulk of DT Venezuelan population appear to oppose an undemocratic regime NN . In March , DT NNP Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in DT Near East ( UNRWA ) MD release a report detailing DT deaths of Palestinians at DT hands of Israeli Defense Forces in DT wake of DT great March of Return protests at DT Gaza - Israel perimeter fence MD approach 200 , with 29,000 injured . In April , Wikileaks founder Julian Assange was forcefully removed from DT Ecuadorean Embassy in DT NNP Kingdom where he had sought sanctuary from a wrongful and unjust prosecution at DT hands of DT U.S . In June , U.S. - Iran tensions MD escalate with attacks on oil tankers in Gulf of Oman near DT Strait of Hormuz culminating in DT drone killing in early January of high ranking Iranian military figure Qasem Soleimani . Popular uprisings around DT globe were unquestionably a feature of DT NN . DT Gilets Jaunes ( Yellow Vests ) movement endured throughout DT entirety of DT NN with weekly demonstrations against DT Macron NN ’s neoliberal reforms . Likewise , DT uprisings in Hong Kong grabbed much of DT NN spotlight , And later in DT NN , DT NN MD see popular eruptions in Ecuador , Chile , and other Latin American centres , in Haiti , in Sudan and in Lebanon . On DT NN NN front , while Greta Thunberg and DT youth NN activists took centre stage in unprecedented numbers , infernos light up DT Amazon , California and Australia , NNS highlight DT threat to JJ food supply from NN NN , DT NN ’s oceans are being depleted of oxygen , DT melting of glacial and polar NN accelerates , and DT UN ’s NNP Meteorological Organization reports IN DT concentration of NN - heating greenhouse gases has hit another all - NN high with “ no sign of a slowdown , let alone a decline . ” And of course , DT impeachment drama in Washington continues to transfix JJ Americans while poverty has increased in 30 percent of U.S counties , and while a bi-partisan consensus on Capitol Hill approved last August military spending exceeding what was spent at DT height of DT Cold War , even adjusting for inflation . For independent NN outlets IN DT NNP Research NNP Hour , NN stories are curated according to how PRP impact DT broader population , not according to their service to DT corporate and NN interests WDT underwrite most press outlets . Through DT lens , DT show takes an overdue opportunity to evaluate some of DT more important stories and developments of DT past NN . Our first guest , Andy Lee Roth of Project Censored , discusses some of DT Top 25 most censored stories of 2018 - 2019 , and other themes from DT publication Censored 2020 . These include NN tank partnerships which turn Facebook into a tool of U.S. Foreign Policy ( 2 ) , high rates of unemployment among formerly incarcerated Americans ( 17 ) , and a more equitable model for providing meals for schoolchildren in DT U.S. ( 23 ) . In DT final half hour , PRP present a wide - ranging conversation on DT NN stories and trends of 2019 featuring independent NN icons Abby and Robbie Martin ( NNP Roots radio ) along with NNP Research NNP Hour co-hosts Michael Welch and Scott Price . Themes range from DT marginalization of dissident viewpoints and analysis under DT guise of controlling ‘ fake NN ’ to DT co-opting of ‘ Deep NNP ’ analysis and ‘ NN culture ’ into a kind of partisan cudgel , to DT growth of DT U.S. empire under NNP , to DT corporate and ecological elements missing from coverage of DT fires raging around DT NN . Abby Martin is an investigative journalist and co-producer of Telesur ’s DT Empire Files . She RB wrote and directed DT 2019 documentary film Gaza Fights for Freedom . She co-hosts DT NNP Roots Radio podcast along with her brother Robbie Martin . Robbie Martin is a writer , musician and film maker . He produced DT three part documentary film series A Very Heavy Agenda , about DT rise and persistent role of DT neocons within DT Washington establishment .

text: hinstrap penguins are exquisitely adapted to their environment . PRP live and breed in some of DT NN ’s harshest conditions , nesting in DT windblown , rocky coves of DT Antarctic Peninsula , a strip of land comprising DT northernmost part of DT frigid continent . In NN PRP are precision hunters , darting after krill , DT tiny shrimp - IN crustaceans WDT are their sole food source , utilizing barbed tongues engineered for catching DT slipperiest of prey . On land , these 2 - 2.5 - foot - tall flightless birds are prodigious mountaineers , able to scale rocky escarpments in spite of their ungainly waddle . Their perfect adaptation to local conditions makes them DT ideal barometer for DT future of DT region . If anything changes in DT marine environment , DT NN of chinstrap penguins will be CD of DT most reliable indicators . PRP are DT canaries of DT Southern Ocean . And these endearing , black and white emissaries from Antarctic waters are starting to disappear . NNS conducting a chinstrap census along DT Antarctic Peninsula have discovered drastic declines in JJ colonies , with some seeing population reductions of up to 77 % since PRP were last surveyed , about 50 NNS ago . DT independent researchers , who hitched a ride on a Greenpeace expedition to DT region , found IN every single CD of DT 32 colonies surveyed on Elephant Island , a major chinstrap outpost , had declined . Overall , DT island ’s total chinstrap population had dropped by more than half , from 122,550 breeding pairs in 1971 to 52,786 in January 2020 . “ Such significant declines suggest IN DT Southern Ocean ’s ecosystem is fundamentally changed from 50 NNS ago , and IN DT impacts of this are rippling up DT food web to species IN chinstrap penguins , ” says Heather J. Lynch , associate professor of ecology & evolution at Stony Brook University in upstate NNP York , who designed DT NN . “ EX is something broken in DT Southern Ocean , ” adds ornithologist Noah Strycker , a member of DT penguin census team , and DT author of DT 2015 book . “ Our best guess on why DT MD be is NN NN , which PRP VBP is hitting DT Antarctic Peninsula region harder than …practically anywhere else in DT NN except DT Arctic . ” NN waters reduce DT NN NN and DT phytoplankton WDT krill depend upon for feeding and survival . Ocean acidification , a side effect of increasing JJ carbon NNS , RB impacts their ability to reproduce . For DT past five weeks Stony Brook NNS have joined forces with robotics and drone specialists from Boston ’s Northeastern University to survey relatively unstudied chinstrap penguin colonies along DT western coast of DT Antarctic Peninsula . Chinstraps prefer rocky , windblown sites for nesting , because PRP provide DT best conditions for keeping eggs safe and dry . Those conditions make research difficult : DT NNS endured freezing temperatures , wind , rain and snow to reach DT coastal rookeries by small inflatable motorboats , then scrambled among DT colonies counting penguins by hand . DT robotics team backed up DT survey with drone footage . When PRP return to DT lab , members of DT team will use DT findings to teach computers how to identify nests using artificial intelligence for help in future surveys . DT researchers surveyed 56 colonies in 37 days . So far , PRP ’ve only released numbers from DT Elephant Island sites , which were DT first to be surveyed . DT final report will be published in a few weeks . But those initial findings appear to be consistent across most colonies . “ From whatever limited data PRP have from DT 1980s , chinstrap populations appear to be down by over half , ” says biologist Steve Forrest , DT team lead on DT expedition . On Jan. 31 , 2020 , 26 days into DT expedition , Forrest motored around DT NNP ’s Head promontory on Snow Island to scout for potential survey sites . Some 30 NNS ago , researchers documented a colony RB , but Forrest had heard rumors from passing boats WDT PRP had disappeared . DT NN was too rough for a census WDT day , but PRP did n’t matter . Peering through a pair of binoculars , Forrest saw no evidence IN EX were any penguins left on DT island at all . “ I was hoping IN PRP might find DT colony after all , ” he says . “ But not finding CD is more along DT lines of what PRP expected . ” Some of DT older surveys in DT more difficult - to - reach areas are unreliable — conducted at a distance , by boat — so an exact assessment of how much has changed in DT last three decades is impossible . Still , Forrest says , he is confident IN chinstrap populations are declining , particularly in DT South Shetland Islands ( including Elephant Island ) off DT coast of DT Peninsula . “ I saw a lot of abandoned nesting places , so I am inclined to believe IN PRP is a real decline , but DT precise extent is uncertain . ” While DT numbers of chinstraps MD be on DT wane , DT researchers saw a marked increase in gentoo penguin populations . Gentoos , which have red - orange beaks and lack DT distinctive black band around DT throat WDT gives chinstraps their names , are much more flexible about what PRP eat and DT conditions under which PRP breed . This means IN PRP can more easily adapt to changes in their environment . Forrest calls them “ NN NN winners ” for their ability to thrive in conditions WDT threaten chinstraps — at least in DT short term . Strycker calls DT process by which DT upstarts take over chinstrap areas “ gentoofication . ” Strycker , a committed birder who chronicled his attempt to spot more than half DT NN ’s bird species in a single NN in a 2017 book called Birding Without Borders : An Obsession , a Quest , and DT Biggest NNP in DT NNP admits IN ultimately , PRP ’s not even about DT penguins . PRP ’s about krill . Krill are DT foundation of DT marine food system — DT fish WDT eat them are DT fodder for DT fish on which almost every ocean predator relies . DT fish WDT PRP humans eat RB primarily rely on krill as a food source . If krill populations are unhealthy , PRP means trouble down DT line for everyone else . But krill , in their krillions , are hard to VB . DT ’s where DT chinstraps come in . IN certain whale species , chinstraps are krill specialists , but PRP are relatively easier to track compared to whales , with their erratic migration patterns . Chinstrap penguins reliably return to DT same rookeries NN after NN to breed , so by assessing colony NN over NN , NNS can VB a better idea of how DT krill PRP depend on are doing . Which is “ why PRP should care about a bunch of penguins VBG missing from a remote island WDT no NN ’s ever heard of , ” says Strycker . “ Penguins give PRP an idea about what is VBG on in DT ocean around PRP . DT ocean processes WDT are changing in DT Antarctic are similar to DT processes WDT are changing everywhere else in DT NN . ” Humans MD not have evolved to catch krill DT way chinstraps do , but our fate is tied to DT tiny crustaceans all DT same .

text: Protecting DT Environment and Addressing NNP NN at Home : November 2008 to January 2017 From DT day he first took office in January 2009 to DT day he left office in January 2017 , NNP Barack Obama believed IN no challenge posed a greater threat to our NNS , our NN , and future generations than NN NN . Indeed , as he saw PRP , acting on NN NN was a moral obligation of DT present , not a distant problem of DT future . And DT ’s because , long before NNP Obama assumed office , DT NN was already changing in ways WDT — if left unchecked — MD have a profound impact on all of humankind . DT scientific evidence accumulated and reviewed over DT past several decades showed unequivocally IN DT NN was NN , primarily due to human activities over DT past 50 NNS . As a result , summers were becoming longer and hotter . Winters were becoming shorter and warmer . NN on land and in lakes and seas was melting . JJ NN levels were rising . And from storms , hurricanes , and heavy downpours to droughts , fires , and floods , extreme weather was becoming more frequent and intense . Simply put , NN NN was dramatically altering DT NN — and altering PRP in ways detrimental to life on NNP . This timeline tells DT story of how DT NNP and his team took action to mitigate DT impacts of NN NN and protect our environment at home . text: Dermatitis is a general term WDT describes a skin irritation . Dermatitis is a common condition WDT has JJ causes and occurs in JJ forms . PRP usually involves itchy , dry skin or a rash on swollen , reddened skin . Or PRP MD cause DT skin to blister , ooze , crust or flake off . Moisturizing regularly helps control DT symptoms . Treatment MD RB include medicated ointments , creams and shampoos . Each type of dermatitis MD look a little different and tends to occur on different parts of your body . Signs and symptoms of different types of dermatitis include : • Atopic dermatitis ( eczema ) . Usually beginning in infancy , this red , itchy rash usually occurs where DT skin flexes — inside DT elbows , behind DT knees and in front of DT neck . DT rash MD leak fluid when scratched and crust over . NNS with atopic dermatitis MD experience improvement and then seasonal flare - ups . • Contact dermatitis . This red , itchy stinging rash occurs where your skin has come into contact with substances WDT irritate DT skin or cause an allergic reaction . PRP MD develop blisters . • Seborrheic dermatitis . This condition causes scaly patches , red skin and stubborn dandruff . PRP usually affects oily areas of DT body , such as DT face , upper chest and back . Seborrheic dermatitis can be a long - term condition with periods of improvement and then seasonal flare - ups . In infants , this condition is called cradle cap . • Follicular eczema . With this type , DT affected skin thickens and develops bumps in hair follicles . This condition is common in African Americans and in NNS with dark - brown skin . This type is caused by a yeast ( fungus ) WDT is in DT oil secretion on DT skin . • Age . NNS who have a personal or family history of eczema , allergies , hay fever or asthma are more likely to develop atopic dermatitis . • Occupation . text: Thousands of NNS around DT NN joined together last month to label NN VB DT “ emergency ” WDT PRP is . But CD of DT main points PRP make — linking control of women ’s reproduction to environmental goals — is problematic . Focusing on what women in poor nations with DT highest birth rates can do to curb NN NN distracts from holding wealthy NNS and corporations accountable for their disproportionate harm to DT NN and imperils DT right to reproductive autonomy . DT paper , “ NNP NNPS ’ Warning of a NNP Emergency , ” was published in early November on DT 40th anniversary of DT first NN NN conference . PRP rightfully warns of “ untold suffering ” without “ major transformations in DT ways our JJ society functions . ” Reducing population growth is CD of six steps DT authors say MD slow carbon dioxide NNS . PRP RB argue IN to decrease DT birthrate , family planning services and primary and secondary education need to be more available and accessible . DT group ’s website goes a big step further . PRP says families must be encouraged to have fewer NNS and sounds DT overpopulation alarm . A startling graph shows a dramatic NN population spike beginning in DT 19th century . DT accompanying text refers to NNS giving birth as “ adding more carbon emitters to DT NN . ” This presents a troubling and unfair picture and promotes DT scapegoating of women . Access to family planning and education are essential to gender equity and must be fiercely promoted in their own right . But arguing IN PRP are an instrument against NN NN implies IN DT most disenfranchised have an outsize role to play in DT fight because of higher birth rates , when in reality PRP contribute very little to greenhouse gas NNS . High - and upper - middle - income NNS have higher per-capita NNS and account for 86 % of JJ carbon NNS , despite having DT lowest fertility rates . And even though some observers argue JJ development will lead to higher per-capita carbon NNS from poor NNS in DT future , DT JJ scientific and policy communities ’ response should be laser - focused on bold systemic changes , such as restraining DT use of fossil fuels , rather than persuading NNS to have fewer NNS . Emphasizing population reduction as a response to JJ NN is RB problematic because PRP MD provide a perverse incentive for family planning services to lose sight of NNS ’s right to make their own decisions about contraception and childbearing . DT NNS ’ warning rightly says IN family planning programs should be voluntary and ethical , but those concepts can start to blur when women ’s choices are put in competition with DT future of DT NN . Historically , population growth alarmism coupled with eugenic ideas about who is worthy of reproducing has led to a painful JJ legacy of coercion and abuse — including , most prominently , NNS of forced sterilization in India and NNP ’s CD - child policy . Such blatant examples have been less common in DT NNS since DT landmark 1994 International Conference on Population and Development marked a shift away from population control toward protecting reproductive NN and rights . However , those ideas have n’t died . Just four NNS ago , Stanford University biologist Paul Ehrlich , who wrote DT 1968 book “ DT Population Bomb , ” VBD he MD endorse “ various forms of coercion ” to keep NNS from having more NNS . An inherent and unresolvable tension remains between viewing family planning as a tool to mitigate NN NN and valuing an individual ’s right to choose to have a child . Framing family planning as a means to an end — especially when DT “ end ” is as urgent and important as slowing NN NN — MD lead anxious policymakers and healthcare providers focused on reducing population to push contraceptive methods WDT are considered more effective , without regard for a woman ’s needs and preferences . PRP MD RB lead them to be less likely to make sure women are able to have provider - controlled methods — such as intrauterine devices or contraceptive implants — removed on demand . Curbing NN NN and making high - quality , rights - based contraception and abortion services accessible to those who VBP them are both urgent issues WDT deserve attention and resources . However , DT misplaced emphasis on poor women ’s reproduction risks sacrificing human rights to chip away at NN NN , a massive problem WDT needs transformational solutions . And PRP RB distracts from DT fact IN poor communities are DT least likely to have DT resources to mitigate DT devastating impact of NN NN on their lives and livelihoods , and thus have DT most to lose . Even if women in poor NNS stopped having NNS tomorrow , without massive decarbonization of DT economy neither DT NN nor their lives will be any better off now or in DT future . As NN - NN NNS continue to push DT NN toward urgent action , PRP should avoid family planning as a solution . Instead , PRP can follow DT lead of DT NN justice movement and promote a human - rights - based approach WDT holds governments and businesses accountable for reducing reliance on fossil fuels — and for mitigating DT disproportionate burden borne by DT most poor and disenfranchised . A bold vision for tackling DT NN emergency requires nothing less . Kelsey Holt is a social and behavioral scientist and researcher with DT Person - Centered Reproductive NNP Program at UC San Francisco .
